page.title: 14Lavant House School
page.content: Lavant House was an Important Georgian Residence and it was sold by the Miller family to the 3rd Duke of Richmond in 1791. The 3rd Duke gave to his daughter, Henrietta Ann Le Clare, the right to live in Lavant House. She married Colonel Dorrien and lived in Lavant House from 1808 and when her husband died in 1826 she became the owner. When Henrietta died Lavant House was occupied by the country gentry. It was also used as a children's home after the 1st world war up to 1928. Lavant House is now a private boarding and day school for girls, Miss Ellis is the present headmistress. There are 120 girls. The cost is Â£1,270.00 for seniors and Â£1,215.00 for juniors to board,and it costs Â£755.00 for seniors and Â£615.00 for juniors per term, for day children.
